availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Noa Spears (Scott county, Kentucky, farmer, bank clerk, and notary public)

body.p: Scott county, Kentucky, farmer, bank clerk, and notary public. Kentucky native. Married to Francis Gano Spears in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1849 Married to Georgia Ann Crockett Spears in Scott County on March 20, 1851. Father of Sue K. Spears and Jacob V. Spears. Married to Mary Chapman Steffee Spears in Scott County on August 9, 1864. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Bourbon county, Kentucky, in 1850. Bank clerk in Scott County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Bourbon county, Kentucky, in 1860. Notary public in Scott County. Bank clerk in Scott County in 1863.
